sentences.text: On 23 June 2024, coordinated attacks were launched in the cities of Derbent and Makhachkala in the Russian republic of Dagestan in the North Caucasus. with automatic weapons and Molotov cocktails. It was reported that 17 police officers and five civilians were killed along with all five attackers. The fatalities included a priest, Nikolay Kotelnikov. The Kele-Numaz Synagogue was nearly completely destroyed by fire in the attack.

sentences.text: Russian authorities designated the attack as an act of terrorism. Russian media reported that five of the perpetrators were identified by authorities, including one son and two nephews of Magomed Omarov, the head of Dagestan's Sergokalinsky District. One of the attackers was a former president of the Sergokala section of the A Just Russia – For Truth Party.

sentences.text: Russian president Vladimir Putin offered condolences to the victims of the attacks. The government of Dagestan declared a three-day national mourning period from 24 to 26 June for those killed in the attacks.

sentences.text: The North Caucasus region of southern Russia has been embroiled in conflict since the 1990s. This predominantly Islam in Russia|Muslim-populated area experienced two significant wars involving the separatist Chechen Republic of Ichkeria|Chechen republic from 1994 to 2000. Following the Second Chechen War|Chechen wars, a series of terrorist attacks and Insurgency in the North Caucasus|clashes between Russian and Islamist forces persisted into the 2010s. Since 2017, the North Caucasus has seen a Islamic State insurgency in the North Caucasus|resurgence of violence, attributed to the Islamic State. In 2015 the group announced that it had established a "franchise" in the North Caucasus.

sentences.text: The History of the Jews in Derbent|Jewish community of Derbent, a part of the Jewish diaspora known as the Mountain Jews, dates back to the 6th century, when Persian Jews (who had emigrated to Persia after the destruction of the First Temple in Jerusalem) settled in Derbent along the Silk Road trade route. Since the outbreak of the Israel–Hamas war in October 2023, History of the Jews in Russia|Russia's Jewish community has faced increasing threats of violence.  On 28 and 29 October of the same year, 2023 antisemitic riots in the North Caucasus|antisemitic riots broke out in the Muslim-majority regions of the Northern Caucasus, including in Dagestan.

sentences.text: In March 2024, Crocus City Hall attack|an attack at a Moscow concert hall killed 145 people; the following month, Russia's FSB security service arrested four people in Dagestan suspected of involvement in the attack. This was the deadliest attack in Russia since the Beslan school siege in 2004, and was claimed by the Islamic State.<ref name="background1"/>

sentences.text:
in Derbent]]
On the evening of 23 June 2024, shortly before 18:00 local time, an attack was launched at the Church of the Intercession of the Holy Virgin of Derbent|Orthodox Church of the Intercession of the Holy Virgin on Lenin Street in Derbent, Dagestan's second-largest city, by attackers with rifles, automatic weapons, and Molotov cocktails.

<ref name="CNN"/><ref name="auto1"/><ref name="auto9"/> The attackers reportedly broke into the church shortly after its holiday Sunday evening service; other clergy at the church managed to lock themselves in safely, and were later rescued.<ref name="auto" /> The church's security guard, armed only with a non-lethal gas pistol, was shot and killed by the attackers.<ref name=":1" /><ref>{{Cite web |author1=Jen Deaton |author2=Darya Tarasova |date=2024-06-23 |title=Priest and police officer killed in attacks on synagogue and church in Russia's Dagestan |url=https://www.cnn.com/2024/06/23/europe/dagestan-synagogue-attack-russia-intl-latam/index.html |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240624114346/https://www.cnn.com/2024/06/23/europe/dagestan-synagogue-attack-russia-intl-latam/index.html |archive-date=24 June 2024 |access-date=2024-06-23 |website=CNN |language=en}}</ref>

sentences.text: The attackers killed the 66-year-old archpriest, set an icon of the church ablaze, and set the church on fire. however, according to his son-in-law, he had first been shot and then stabbed.

sentences.text: It was one of two churches that were attacked during one of the most important holidays in the Eastern Orthodox liturgical calendar|Eastern Orthodox calendar, Pentecost Sunday in the Russian Orthodox Church, reportedly as attackers yelled ''"Takbir|Allahu Akbar"''.

sentences.text: At approximately the same time, in addition to the church, the Derbent Derbent Synagogue|Kele-Numaz Synagogue, which had been established in 1914, was fired upon with automatic weapons, and set on fire by the attackers. Telegram users posted videos showing police cars being shot at, and the synagogue on fire. Afterwards a video was posted to Telegram (software)|Telegram by Melikov showing the remains of the synagogue, which was almost completely destroyed by the fire.

<ref>{{cite news |date=24 June 2024 |title=Внутри — пепелище. Видео из сожженной синагоги в Дербенте |trans-title=Inside – ashes. Video from the burnt synagogue in Derbent |url=https://www.fontanka.ru/2024/06/24/73745306/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240625052425/https://www.fontanka.ru/2024/06/24/73745306/ |archive-date=25 June 2024 |access-date=24 June 2024 |work=fontanka.ru |language=ru}}</ref>

<ref>{{cite news |date=24 June 2024 |title=Меликов приехал в атакованные боевиками церковь и синагогу в Дербенте |trans-title=Melikov arrives at the Derbent church and synagogue attacked by militants |url=https://www.rbc.ru/politics/24/06/2024/6679275e9a7947bc53c6bce0 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240624092654/https://www.rbc.ru/politics/24/06/2024/6679275e9a7947bc53c6bce0 |archive-date=24 June 2024 |access-date=24 June 2024 |work=RBK Group|RBK |language=ru}}</ref>

sentences.text: The attackers fled in a white Volkswagen Polo. Nineteen people sought shelter in the church before being rescued.

references.text: <ref name="moscow">{{Cite web |title=Several Killed in Church and Synagogue Attacks in Russia's Dagestan |url=https://www.themoscowtimes.com/2024/06/23/several-killed-in-church-and-synagogue-attacks-in-russias-dagestan-a85496 |access-date=2024-06-24 |website=The Moscow Times |date=23 June 2024 |language=en |archive-date=24 June 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240624045020/https://www.themoscowtimes.com/2024/06/23/several-killed-in-church-and-synagogue-attacks-in-russias-dagestan-a85496 |url-status=live }}</ref>

sentences.text: Almost simultaneously with the attacks in Derbent, attacks were launched against targets in Makhachkala, Dagestan's capital and largest city, about 75 miles (125 kilometers) away.

references.text: <ref name="auto6"/><ref name="auto3"/><ref name="auto2"/><ref name="auto5">{{Cite web|url=https://abc7.com/post/derbent-russia-attack-9-killed-amid-synagogue-orthodox/14993034/|title=Officers among 9 killed as attacks launched on synagogue, Orthodox church in Russia: officials|date=23 June 2024|website=ABC7 Los Angeles|access-date=24 June 2024|archive-date=23 June 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240623233909/https://abc7.com/post/derbent-russia-attack-9-killed-amid-synagogue-orthodox/14993034/|url-status=live}}</ref>

sentences.text: A fire was started in a synagogue on Ermoshkina Street in Makhachkala. The militants also simultaneously attacked the Cathedral of the Assumption of Makhachkala|Cathedral of the Assumption, another Russian Orthodox church.<ref name="auto3" /><ref name="auto7" />

references.text: <ref name="auto3"/><ref name="auto2"/><ref name="auto5"/> The fire was later extinguished, and no victims were reported.<ref>{{cite news |title=Еврейские религиозные организации сообщили об атаке на синагогу в Махачкале |url=https://ria.ru/20240623/sinagoga-1954930158.html |trans-title=Jewish religious organizations inform of attack on synagogue in Makhachkala |access-date=23 June 2024 |work=RIA Novosti |date=23 June 2024 |language=ru |archive-date=23 June 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240623211545/https://ria.ru/20240623/sinagoga-1954930158.html |url-status=live }}</ref>

<ref>{{cite news |title=Нападения в Махачкале и Дербенте: что известно на данный момент |trans-title=Attacks in Makhachkala and Derbent: what we currently know |url=https://www.bbc.com/russian/articles/cl7771zvpj8o |access-date=24 June 2024 |work=BBC News Русская служба |date=23 June 2024 |language=ru |archive-date=24 June 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240624164352/https://www.bbc.com/russian/articles/cl7771zvpj8o |url-status=live }}</ref>

sentences.text: In the evening, unidentified gunmen opened fire on a police car in the square in the center of the village of Sergokala when the police arrived to detain the head of Sergokalinsky District, Magomed Omarov, whose two sons and nephew participated in the terrorist attack in Makhachkala. One police officer was wounded.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |date=2024-06-23 |title=В центре села рядом с Дербентом неизвестные обстреляли полицейскую машину |url=https://www.rbc.ru/politics/23/06/2024/667870ce9a794776deee6e56 |access-date=2024-06-25 |website=РБК |language=ru |archive-date=24 June 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240624055132/https://www.rbc.ru/politics/23/06/2024/667870ce9a794776deee6e56 |url-status=live }}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite web |date=2024-06-23 |title=На площади в дагестанском Сергокале неизвестные в обстреляли машину полицейских |url=https://www.kommersant.ru/doc/6789145 |access-date=2024-06-25 |website=Коммерсантъ |language=ru |archive-date=23 June 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240623215411/https://www.kommersant.ru/doc/6789145 |url-status=live }}</ref>

sentences.text: The total fatalities reported were 17 police officers and five civilians,

references.text: <ref name="mt22"/> along with at least five perpetrators.<ref name=":13" /><ref name="apnews" /> At least 46 others were injured in the attacks, including 13 police officers. Four of the injured police officers were described as being in "grave" condition.<ref name=":11">{{Cite web |date=2024-06-24 |title=Russian region of Dagestan holds a day of mourning after attacks kill 20 people, officials say |url=https://apnews.com/article/dagestan-militant-attacks-church-synagogue-police-84b57fbaa2d087eeb4ef87fa73b65f74 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240625051926/https://apnews.com/article/dagestan-militant-attacks-church-synagogue-police-84b57fbaa2d087eeb4ef87fa73b65f74 |archive-date=25 June 2024 |access-date=2024-06-24 |website=Associated Press |language=en}}</ref>

sentences.text: Authorities said that four attackers were killed by police in Makhachkala, while others were killed in Derbent. authorities said all five were later killed.<ref name=":13" />

references.text: <ref name=":14" /> While some of the attackers initially fled in a car,<ref>{{Cite web |date=2024-06-24 |title=Terrorist attacks in Russia's Dagestan region target church, synagogue and police, kill at least 19 people |url=https://www.cbsnews.com/news/synagogue-church-gunmen-attack-russia-dagestan/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240624093553/https://www.cbsnews.com/news/synagogue-church-gunmen-attack-russia-dagestan/ |archive-date=24 June 2024 |access-date=2024-06-24 |website=CBS News |language=en-US}}</ref>

sentences.text: The attackers who were killed were subsequently identified. Russian media reported that several relatives of Magomed Omarov, the head of Dagestan's Sergokalinsky District, were among the perpetrators of the attacks.<ref name=":3" /><ref name=":4" /> They were identified as:

references.text: <ref>{{cite news |date=23 June 2024 |title=Источник сообщил о задержании главы района в Дагестане Магомеда Омарова |trans-title=Source informs of detainment of head of Sergokalinsky district Magomed Omarov |url=https://iz.ru/1717017/2024-06-23/istochnik-soobshchil-o-zaderzhanii-glavy-raiona-v-dagestane-magomeda-omarova |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240624052118/https://iz.ru/1717017/2024-06-23/istochnik-soobshchil-o-zaderzhanii-glavy-raiona-v-dagestane-magomeda-omarova |archive-date=24 June 2024 |access-date=23 June 2024 |work=Izvestiya}}</ref>

<ref>{{cite news |date=23 June 2024 |title=В нападении в Дагестане участвовали сыновья и племянник главы Сергокалинского района |trans-title=The sons and nephew of the head of Sergokalinsky District involved in attack on Dagestan |url=https://meduza.io/news/2024/06/23/baza-v-napadenii-v-dagestane-uchastvovali-synovya-glavy-sergokalinskogo-rayona |access-date=23 June 2024 |work=Meduza |language=ru}}</ref>

sentences.text:
* Osman Omarov, 31, son of Magomed Omarov
* Abdusamad Amadziev, 32, nephew of Magomed Omarov
* Gadzhimurad Kagirov, 28, an MMA fighter with Eagles MMA (a club owned by Khabib Nurmagomedov), student of Abdulmanap Nurmagomedov
* Dalgat Daudov, 42 or 43 years old, head of a building cooperative, and coworker of the Omarov brothers in another building cooperative
Osman Omarov, Amadziev, and Daudov were the perpetrators of the attack in Makhachkala; Zakarigaev and Kagirov were the perpetrators of the attack in Derbent.  Radio Free Europe reported that the attackers may be part of the Mekegin clan, a group with ties to the Dagestani leadership.

references.text: <ref name=":10">{{Cite web |last1=Tarasova |first1=Darya |last2=Gigova |first2=Radina |date=2024-06-24 |title=Mixed martial arts fighter, relatives of regional official among Dagestan attackers, Russian authorities say |url=https://www.cnn.com/2024/06/24/europe/mma-fighter-dagestan-attack-intl-latam/index.html |access-date=2024-06-25 |website=CNN |language=en |archive-date=25 June 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240625140945/https://www.cnn.com/2024/06/24/europe/mma-fighter-dagestan-attack-intl-latam/index.html |url-status=live }}</ref>

<ref name="ng2">{{cite news |last=Serafimov |first=Andrey |date=24 June 2024 |title=Что известно о нападавших на православные храмы и синагогу в Дагестане? |trans-title=What do we know about the attackers of the Orthodox churches and synagogue in Dagestan? |url=https://novayagazeta.eu/articles/2024/06/24/chto-izvestno-o-napadavshikh-na-pravoslavnye-khramy-i-sinagogu-v-dagestane |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240624230901/https://novayagazeta.eu/articles/2024/06/24/chto-izvestno-o-napadavshikh-na-pravoslavnye-khramy-i-sinagogu-v-dagestane |archive-date=24 June 2024 |access-date=25 June 2024 |work=Novaya Gazeta Europe |lang=ru}}</ref>

<ref name="ng1" /><ref>{{Cite web |date=2024-06-24 |title=В одном из боевиков из Дербента узнали бойца MMA и воспитанника Нурмагомедова |url=https://www.gazeta.ru/social/news/2024/06/24/23309155.shtml |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240625041459/https://www.gazeta.ru/social/news/2024/06/24/23309155.shtml |archive-date=25 June 2024 |access-date=2024-06-24 |website=Газета.Ru |language=ru}}</ref>

<ref name=":14">{{Cite web |last=Shenheliia |first=Kateryna |date=2024-06-24 |title=What We Know About the Church and Synagogue Attacks in Dagestan |url=https://www.themoscowtimes.com/2024/06/24/what-we-know-about-church-and-synagogue-attacks-in-dagestan-a85498 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240624100903/https://www.themoscowtimes.com/2024/06/24/what-we-know-about-church-and-synagogue-attacks-in-dagestan-a85498 |archive-date=24 June 2024 |access-date=2024-06-24 |website=The Moscow Times |language=en}}</ref>

<ref name="ng2" />
* Ali Zakarigaev, 35, former president of the Sergokala section of the A Just Russia – For Truth party (until 2022), and nephew of Magomed Omarov<ref name=":6" /><ref>{{cite news |date=24 June 2024 |title=СК сообщил об установлении личностей всех ликвидированных в Дагестане боевиков |trans-title=Investigative Committee informs of confirmation of identities of all liquidated terrorists in Dagestan |url=https://iz.ru/1717212/2024-06-24/sk-soobshchil-ob-ustanovlenii-lichnostei-vsekh-likvidirovannykh-v-dagestane-boevikov?from=read_more |access-date=24 June 2024 |work=Izvestiya |lang=ru}}</ref>

<ref name="bbc1"/><ref>{{cite news |title=РИА Новости нашло дом экс-главы Сергокалинского района Омарова |url=https://ria.ru/20240625/omarov-1955200314.html |access-date=25 June 2024 |work=RIA Novosti |date=25 June 2024 |language=ru |archive-date=26 June 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240626172100/https://ria.ru/20240625/omarov-1955200314.html |url-status=live }}</ref>

<ref name="bbc1">{{cite news |title=Атака на Дагестан: что стало известно спустя двое суток |trans-title=The attack on Dagestan: what we know after 2 days |url=https://www.bbc.com/russian/articles/cd11xqlxxedo |access-date=25 June 2024 |work=BBC News Русская служба |date=25 June 2024 |language=ru |archive-date=26 June 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240626171906/https://www.bbc.com/russian/articles/cd11xqlxxedo |url-status=live }}</ref>

<ref>{{cite news |title=Daghestan Holds Second Day Of Mourning After At Least 20 Killed In Attacks |url=https://www.rferl.org/a/daghenstan-mkhachkala-derbent-russia-attack/33008031.html |access-date=25 June 2024 |work=RadioFreeEurope/RadioLiberty |date=25 June 2024 |language=en |archive-date=26 June 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240626172037/https://www.rferl.org/a/daghenstan-mkhachkala-derbent-russia-attack/33008031.html |url-status=live }}</ref>

sentences.text: Magomed Omarov himself submitted a resignation letter and was subsequently detained and questioned by the Russian Federal Security Service. On 24 June, Sergey Melikov officially dismissed Omarov from his post. Melikov said that he would not comment on the degree of Omarov's involvement but said "if his participation is confirmed, then there will be full responsibility". Another son of Omarov, 37-year-old Adil Omarov,<ref name="bbc1" />

references.text: <ref name=":5" /> Later, Omarov was expelled from the United Russia party, the ruling political party in Russia, "for actions that discredit United Russia".<ref>{{Cite web |date=2024-06-24 |title=Из «Единой России» исключили отца боевиков, напавших на Дагестан |url=https://www.rbc.ru/politics/24/06/2024/6678a7b99a794709507be065 |access-date=2024-06-24 |website=РБК |language=ru |archive-date=25 June 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240625140958/https://www.rbc.ru/politics/24/06/2024/6678a7b99a794709507be065 |url-status=live }}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite news |last=Roth |first=Andrew |date=24 June 2024 |title=Dagestan attack highlights Russia's vulnerability at home amid Ukraine war |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/article/2024/jun/24/dagestan-attack-highlights-russias-islamist-terror-threat-as-forces-are-engaged-in-ukraine |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240625044218/https://www.theguardian.com/world/article/2024/jun/24/dagestan-attack-highlights-russias-islamist-terror-threat-as-forces-are-engaged-in-ukraine |archive-date=25 June 2024 |access-date=24 June 2024 |newspaper=The Guardian}}</ref>

<ref name=":10" /> Omarov was then arrested for 10 days on charges of "minor hooliganism"; Russian media reports state that he may face terrorism charges.<ref>{{cite news |title=В Дагестане арестовали на 10 суток главу Сергокалинского района |url=https://tass.ru/proisshestviya/21197333 |access-date=25 June 2024 |work=TASS |date=25 June 2024 |language=ru}}</ref>

<ref>{{cite news |title=Бывшего главу Сергокалинского района арестовали на 10 суток по делу о мелком хулиганстве. Его сыновей подозревают в нападениях в Дагестане |url=https://meduza.io/news/2024/06/25/byvshego-glavu-sergokalinskogo-rayona-arestovali-na-10-sutok-po-delu-o-melkom-huliganstve-ego-synovey-podozrevayut-v-napadeniyah-v-dagestane |access-date=25 June 2024 |work=Meduza |date=25 June 2024 |language=ru |archive-date=26 June 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240626172032/https://meduza.io/news/2024/06/25/byvshego-glavu-sergokalinskogo-rayona-arestovali-na-10-sutok-po-delu-o-melkom-huliganstve-ego-synovey-podozrevayut-v-napadeniyah-v-dagestane |url-status=live }}</ref>

<ref>{{cite news |title=Daghestani Official Fired After Deadly Attacks Gets 10 Days In Jail |url=https://www.rferl.org/a/russia-daghestan-attacks-omarov-jailed/33008772.html |access-date=25 June 2024 |work=RadioFreeEurope/RadioLiberty |date=25 June 2024 |language=en |archive-date=26 June 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240626172044/https://www.rferl.org/a/russia-daghestan-attacks-omarov-jailed/33008772.html |url-status=live }}</ref>

<ref name=":10" /><ref name=":12" /> was detained by police.<ref>{{cite news |date=24 June 2024 |title=Участник нападения в Дагестане, один из сыновей Омарова, пропал из списка погибших. Все нападавшие — односельчане, многие из богатых семей |trans-title=A participant of the attack in Dagestan, one of the sons of Omarov, disappeared from the list of deaths. All the attackers were from one village, many were from rich families |url=https://theins.ru/news/272627 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240626171906/https://theins.ru/news/272627 |archive-date=26 June 2024 |access-date=26 June 2024 |work=The Insider (website)|The Insider |language=ru}}</ref>

<ref>{{cite news |date=25 June 2024 |title=Объявленного убитым террористом сына главы муниципалитета в Дагестане не было среди нападавших. Его задержали и отправили в отдел полиции |trans-title=Municipal head of Dagestan's son, announced as a dead terrorist, was not one of the attackers. He was detained and send to the police |url=https://theins.ru/news/272659 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240626171937/https://theins.ru/news/272659 |archive-date=26 June 2024 |access-date=26 June 2024 |work=The Insider |language=ru}}</ref>

sentences.text: Russia's state-run news agency TASS said the attackers were "followers of an international terrorist organization" and that law enforcement officials were identifying their handlers and organizers, but failed to name the organization. Many militants from Dagestan traveled to join the Islamic State in Syria and Iraq, and in 2015 the group declared that it had established a "franchise" in the North Caucasus. Dagestan governor Melikov blamed members of Islamic "sleeper cells" directed from abroad. Islamic State – Khorasan Province|ISKP praised the attackers as "brothers in the Caucasus who showed that they are still strong".<ref name=":11" />

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |date=2024-06-23 |title=ТАСС: напавшие в Дагестане входили в международную террористическую организацию |url=https://www.kommersant.ru/doc/6789134 |access-date=2024-06-24 |website=Коммерсантъ |language=ru |archive-date=25 June 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240625041112/https://www.kommersant.ru/doc/6789134 |url-status=live }}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite web |date=2024-06-23 |title=Устроившие стрельбу в Дагестане являются членами террористической организации |url=https://www.vedomosti.ru/politics/news/2024/06/23/1045660-ustroivshie-strelbu-v-dagestane/ |access-date=2024-06-24 |website=Ведомости |language=ru |archive-date=24 June 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240624043314/https://www.vedomosti.ru/politics/news/2024/06/23/1045660-ustroivshie-strelbu-v-dagestane |url-status=live }}</ref>

<ref name="auto10">[https://www.npr.org/2024/06/24/g-s1-5882/dagestan-attacks-russia-synagogue-orthodox "Russian region of Dagestan holds a day of mourning after attacks kill 19 people,"] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240624152559/https://www.npr.org/2024/06/24/g-s1-5882/dagestan-attacks-russia-synagogue-orthodox |date=24 June 2024 }} NPR.</ref>

<ref name="auto4">{{Cite web |date=2024-06-24 |title=Anti-terror operation against deadly Dagestan attack over, say Russian authorities |url=https://www.france24.com/en/europe/20240624-anti-terror-operation-against-deadly-dagestan-attack-over-say-russian-authorities |access-date=2024-06-24 |website=France 24 |language=en |archive-date=24 June 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240624093425/https://www.france24.com/en/europe/20240624-anti-terror-operation-against-deadly-dagestan-attack-over-say-russian-authorities |url-status=live }}</ref>

<ref name="auto10" /><ref>{{cite news |date=24 June 2024 |title=В Дагестане при нападении боевиков погибли более 15 полицейских |trans-title=Over 15 police officers killed in attack on Dagestan |url=https://meduza.io/news/2024/06/24/v-dagestane-pri-napadenii-boevikov-pogibli-bolee-15-politseyskih |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240624060024/https://meduza.io/news/2024/06/24/v-dagestane-pri-napadenii-boevikov-pogibli-bolee-15-politseyskih |archive-date=24 June 2024 |access-date=24 June 2024 |work=Meduza |language=ru}}</ref>

sentences.text: SITE Intelligence Group linked the attack to "IS" (the Islamic State militant cult).

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web|url=https://ent.siteintelgroup.com/Jihadist-Threat-Statements/saluting-lone-wolves-inspired-by-its-ideology-is-says-faith-based-brotherhood-triumphs-over-organizational-ties.html|title=Saluting Lone Wolves Inspired by its Ideology, IS Says Faith-based Brotherhood Triumphs Over Organizational Ties|website=SITE|date=2024-07-04}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://ent.siteintelgroup.com/Jihadist-Threat-Multimedia/pro-is-unit-applies-flames-of-war-to-russia-in-glorifying-attacks-in-moscow-dagestan-and-ingushetia.html|title=Pro-IS Unit Applies "Flames of War" to Russia in Glorifying Attacks in Moscow, Dagestan, and Ingushetia|website=SITE|date=2024-07-08}}</ref>

sentences.text: The government of Dagestan declared a three-day national mourning period from 24 to 26 June for those killed in the attacks. Sergei Melikov also ordered an "inspection and scrutinization of the personal records of all those in leadership positions" in Dagestan.

references.text: <ref name=":9" /> On these days of mourning, national flags were to be flown throughout the territory of the republic. Cultural institutions and television and radio companies in Dagestan were to cancel all their entertainment events and programs.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2024-06-24 |title=Russia's Dagestan announces 3-day mourning in connection with terrorist attacks |url=https://news.am/eng/news/830700.html |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240625052426/https://news.am/eng/news/830700.html |archive-date=25 June 2024 |access-date=2024-06-24 |website=news.am |language=en}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite web |date=24 June 2024 |title=More than a dozen killed in Dagestan following attack on churches and synagogue |url=https://www.itv.com/watch/news/more-than-a-dozen-killed-in-dagestan-following-attack-on-churches-and-synagogue/4spm78x |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240625052532/https://www.itv.com/watch/news/more-than-a-dozen-killed-in-dagestan-following-attack-on-churches-and-synagogue/4spm78x |archive-date=25 June 2024 |access-date=24 June 2024 |website=Itv}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite web |date=25 June 2024 |title=Russia's Dagestan to Inspect Local Officials After Attacks on Religious Sites |url=https://www.themoscowtimes.com/2024/06/25/russias-dagestan-to-inspect-local-officials-after-attacks-on-religious-sites-a85515 |access-date=26 June 2024 |website=The Moscow Times |archive-date=26 June 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240626172034/https://www.themoscowtimes.com/2024/06/25/russias-dagestan-to-inspect-local-officials-after-attacks-on-religious-sites-a85515 |url-status=live }}</ref>

sentences.text: Kotelnikov was buried on 26 June on the grounds of the Church of the Intercession of the Holy Virgin, where he had served since 1979. Tens of mourners of diverse faiths attended the funeral.

references.text: <ref name="ng6" /><ref>{{cite news |title=В Дербенте похоронили погибшего от рук террористов священника |trans-title=Priest murdered by terrorists buried in Derbent |url=https://www.rbc.ru/rbcfreenews/667bfddf9a794799f0c419dd?from=story_667854099a7947d45cea1ddc |access-date=27 June 2024 |work=RBK |date=26 June 2024 |language=ru}}</ref>

sentences.text: Russian President Vladimir Putin offered condolences to the victims of the attacks. He bestowed the Order of Courage (Russia)|Order of Courage on Kotelnikov and the dead police officers; the other police officers involved received Medal "For Bravery" (Russia)|Medals "for Bravery", and the guard of the church posthumously received the Medal "for Valour" ({{langx|ru|Медаль «За отвагу»}}). According to his press secretary, Dmitry Peskov, Putin does not plan to make a special address regarding the Dagestan attacks.<ref name=":14" />

references.text: <ref>{{cite news |title=Президент РФ наградил орденом Мужества погибшего в Дагестане протоиерея |url=https://kavkaz.rbc.ru/kavkaz/freenews/667b10e59a79477f742f1cc9 |access-date=27 June 2024 |trans-title=President of RF awards Order of Courage to murdered in Dagestan priest |work=RBC |date=25 June 2024}}</ref>

<ref>{{cite news |title=Путин наградил 20 дагестанских полицейских орденом, включая погибших |url=https://ria.ru/20240625/nagrady-1955451496.html |access-date=25 June 2024 |work=RIA Novosti |date=25 June 2024 |language=ru |archive-date=26 June 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240626171907/https://ria.ru/20240625/nagrady-1955451496.html |url-status=live }}</ref>

<ref name=":7">{{cite news |title=Nineteen dead in attacks on churches and synagogue in southern Russia |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/crgggwg158do |access-date=24 June 2024 |work=BBC |date=24 June 2024 |language=en |archive-date=25 June 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240625041024/https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/crgggwg158do |url-status=live }}</ref>

<ref>{{cite news |title=Песков: Путин не планирует выступить с обращением в связи с терактами |url=https://tass.ru/politika/21181479 |access-date=27 June 2024 |work=TASS |date=24 June 2024 |language=ru |trans-title=Peskov: Putin does not plan to make an address in connection with the terrorist attacks}}</ref>

sentences.text: Tatyana Moskalkova, Russia's commissioner for human rights, condemned the perpetrators of the attacks, and expressed condolences for those affected. The head of Ingushetia, Mahmud-Ali Kalimatov, claimed that the terrorist attacks and a June 2024 Sevastopol missile attack|Ukrainian bombing in Sevastopol that occurred on the same day were linked together as attempts by "enemies" to destabilize the country. Head of the Committee on International Affairs of the State Duma Leonid Slutsky (politician)|Leonid Slutsky wrote on Telegram that the attacks were planned from outside Russia for the purpose of "sowing panic and dividing the Russian people", and also connected it to the attack on Sevastopol. Member of the People's Assembly of the Republic of Dagestan Abdulkhakim Gadzhiyev posted on Telegram that there was "no doubt" that the intelligence services of Ukraine and NATO countries were connected to the attacks. President of Chechnya Ramzan Kadyrov called the attack an attempt to cause "discord between faiths". The head of A Just Russia - For Truth, Sergey Mironov, proposed the death sentence for terrorists.

references.text: <ref>{{cite news |title=Москалькова осудила теракты в Махачкале и Дербенте |url=https://ria.ru/20240623/moskalkova-1954929860.html?in=t |access-date=23 June 2024 |trans-title=Moskalkova condemns terrorist attacks in Makhachkala and Derbent |work=RIA Novosti |date=23 June 2024 |language=ru |archive-date=24 June 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240624030616/https://ria.ru/20240623/moskalkova-1954929860.html?in=t |url-status=live }}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite web |title=Нападения в Дагестане: задержан глава района, некоторые уже приплетают Украину |url=https://www.pravda.com.ua/rus/news/2024/06/23/7462196/ |access-date=2024-06-24 |website=Украинская правда |language=ru |archive-date=24 June 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240624014724/https://www.pravda.com.ua/rus/news/2024/06/23/7462196/ |url-status=live }}</ref>

<ref name=":3">{{cite news |last1=Astier |first1=Henri |last2=Gozzi |first2=Laura |title=Dagestan: Deadly attacks on churches and synagogue in southern Russia |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/crgggwg158do |access-date=24 June 2024 |work=BBC |date=24 June 2024 |archive-date=25 June 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240625041024/https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/crgggwg158do |url-status=live }}</ref>

<ref>{{cite news |title=Слуцкий назвал инспирированными извне теракты в Севастополе и Дагестане |trans-title=Slutsky called the attacks in Sevastopol and Dagestan "orchestrated from outside" |url=https://iz.ru/1717136/2024-06-24/slutckii-nazval-inspirirovannymi-izvne-terakty-v-sevastopole-i-dagestane |access-date=24 June 2024 |work=Izvestiya |lang=ru |date=24 June 2024}}</ref>

<ref name=":2" /> At the same time, Federal Senator Dmitry Rogozin called for not considering the terrorist attack as "the machinations of Ukraine and NATO", since, in his opinion, if all such attacks are explained in this way, it will lead to problems.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2024-06-24 |title=Рогозин призвал не считать теракт в Дагестане «происками Украины и НАТО» |url=https://www.rbc.ru/politics/24/06/2024/667876d79a79472215cced73 |access-date=2024-06-24 |website=РБК |language=ru |archive-date=24 June 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240624040619/https://www.rbc.ru/politics/24/06/2024/667876d79a79472215cced73 |url-status=live }}</ref>

<ref name=":2">{{Cite web |date=2024-06-23 |title=Боевики убили полицейских в российском Дагестане |url=https://ru.euronews.com/2024/06/23/dagestan-terrorist-attack |access-date=2024-06-24 |website=Euronews |language=ru |archive-date=24 June 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240624020334/https://ru.euronews.com/2024/06/23/dagestan-terrorist-attack |url-status=live }}</ref>

<ref>{{cite news |title=Миронов предложил смертную казнь для террористов |url=https://ria.ru/20240624/terroristy-1955063867.html |access-date=25 June 2024 |work=RIA Novosti |date=24 June 2024 |language=ru |archive-date=26 June 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240626172049/https://ria.ru/20240624/terroristy-1955063867.html |url-status=live }}</ref>

sentences.text: The Israeli foreign ministry and the Federation of Jewish Communities of Russia said that the synagogue of Derbent had been "burned to the ground". According to Khizri Abakarov, senator Suleiman Kerimov promised to finance the restoration of the damaged churches and synagogues, and to pay 5 million rubles each to the families of the deceased.

references.text: <ref name="CNN">{{Cite web |last1=Knight |first1=Mariya |last2=Tarasova |first2=Darya |last3=Deaton |first3=Jen |date=2024-06-23 |title=Gunmen kill police, priest and civilians in attacks on places of worship in Russia's Dagestan |url=https://www.cnn.com/2024/06/23/europe/dagestan-synagogue-attack-russia-intl-latam/index.html |access-date=2024-06-23 |website=CNN |language=en |archive-date=24 June 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240624114346/https://www.cnn.com/2024/06/23/europe/dagestan-synagogue-attack-russia-intl-latam/index.html |url-status=live }}</ref>
